file_insights.purpose: English translation dictionary for backend error messages and API responses
file_insights.structure: Nested JSON with 9 categories: auth, users, authorization, resources, validation, database, files, server, operations
key_observations: Comprehensive error message coverage across authentication, user management, authorization, and resource operations
Each category contains 4-11 specific error codes with human-readable messages
Messages are user-friendly and descriptive, suitable for API responses
Covers both error scenarios and success operation confirmations

file_insights.purpose: Hebrew translation dictionary for backend error messages and API responses
file_insights.structure: Identical structure to en.json with Hebrew translations
key_observations: Complete Hebrew translations maintaining semantic equivalence with English messages
Proper use of Hebrew formatting conventions (e.g., דוא״ל for email)
All 76 translation keys perfectly aligned with English counterparts
Right-to-left language considerations properly handled in JSON format

patterns_discovered.description: Errors organized by domain (auth, users, authorization, resources, validation, database, files, server, operations) enabling logical grouping and easier error message retrieval
patterns_discovered.impact: Facilitates maintainability and scalability of error handling system

patterns_discovered.description: Snake_case keys (e.g., email_already_registered, invalid_credentials) maintain consistency across all translation files
patterns_discovered.impact: Makes it easy to find and reference specific error messages in code

patterns_discovered.description: Both English and Hebrew translation files contain identical structure with corresponding translations, ensuring feature parity across supported languages
patterns_discovered.impact: Enables seamless internationalization without code duplication

patterns_discovered.description: Dictionary includes both error messages and success operation messages (creation_successful, update_successful, deletion_successful)
patterns_discovered.impact: Centralizes all user-facing API response messages in one location

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: No locale for other languages beyond English and Hebrew
gotchas_discovered.description: Only two language dictionaries created, may need expansion for other supported languages
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Follow same structure when adding additional language locales

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: No namespace separation between message types
gotchas_discovered.description: Success messages and error messages share the same categorization structure, which could cause confusion during error handling
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Consider adding separate sections for success vs error messages in future iterations

gotchas_discovered.description: Translation dictionaries don't include information about which HTTP status codes correspond to each error message
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Add comments or separate mapping file to document HTTP status code associations

gotchas_discovered.description: Messages are static strings without placeholders for dynamic content (e.g., user ID, resource name)
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Implement i18n library with interpolation support if dynamic content needed in messages

approach_outcome.summary: Translation dictionaries successfully created for both English and Hebrew with comprehensive coverage of backend error messages and API responses
deliverables_met: English translation file (en.json) created with 76 translation keys
Hebrew translation file (he.json) created with 76 translation keys
Consistent hierarchical structure across both files
Coverage of all major error categories: authentication, user management, authorization, resources, validation, database, files, server, operations
quality_metrics: 100% key parity between English and Hebrew files
Organized into 9 logical categories for easy maintenance
User-friendly, clear message text suitable for API responses
Successfully committed with clear commit message

recommendations.description: Implement a library like i18next or similar to support parameter interpolation for dynamic error messages (e.g., 'User {userId} not found')

recommendations.recommendation: Create HTTP status code mapping document
recommendations.description: Document which HTTP status codes correspond to each error category to guide API developers
Create translation files for other supported languages following the same structure

recommendations.recommendation: Separate success and error message categories
recommendations.description: Consider restructuring to have distinct 'errors' and 'success' sections for clearer semantics
Create automated tests to ensure all keys in en.json are present in he.json and any new locales
